conclusion: Determine the work done by the gas from state A to state B on the p-V diagram.
State A and State B lie on a horizontal line in the p-V diagram, indicating constant pressure.
Pressure at A and B is 1 x 10^5 Pa; Volume at A is 3 L; Volume at B is 4 L.
For an isobaric process, work done W is given by W = P ΔV.
Calculate change in volume: ΔV = V_B - V_A = 1 L.
Convert L to m³: 1 L = 1 x 10^-3 m³.
Calculate work done: W = (1 x 10^5 Pa) x (1 x 10^-3 m³) = 100 J.
The work done by the gas from state A to state B is 100 J.
